conclusion: In a v-t graph, acceleration equals the gradient (slope) of the curve.

conclusion: Moving from t = 0 toward t₁, the slope of each curve is positive and fairly steep near t = 0.

conclusion: The slope becomes progressively smaller until it is zero at the top of the arch.

conclusion: The slope then becomes negative and grows in magnitude (the tangent gets steeper downhill).

premise: The slope of each curve is positive and fairly steep near t = 0, becomes progressively smaller until it is zero at the top of the arch, then becomes negative and grows in magnitude.
conclusion: Because the numerical value of the slope goes from a positive number through zero to an increasingly negative number, the acceleration is monotonically decreasing throughout the interval 0 → t₁.
